summary: Email chain from August 2019 between FBI and USMS personnel discussing the USMS's role in investigating sex offender registration compliance for Jeffrey Epstein on Little St. James island, and coordination for a potential search. It reveals inter-agency communication and the USMS's reliance on territorial authorities for compliance checks.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Registered sex offender subject of investigation
persons.context: The subject of sex offender registration compliance checks on Little St. James island by the USMS and territorial authorities.

events.title: USMS inquiry about Epstein compliance checks
events.description: The FBI contacts the USMS to ask who has the most knowledge of Little St. James island and if periodic checks on Jeffrey Epstein have been conducted there.

events.title: FBI request for participation in search
events.description: An FBI official requests the USMS case agent be contacted regarding the possibility of the USMS participating in a search, likely related to Epstein.

keyFacts: The USMS investigates 18 USC 2250 charges (failure to register as a sex offender) in conjunction with states, territories, and tribes.
The USMS is completely reliant on territorial authorities being compliant with SORNA (Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act) requirements for their investigations.
To the knowledge of the USMS Chief Deputy, the USMS has not been present with territorial authorities when/if they conducted compliance checks on Jeffrey Epstein on Little St. James.
The FBI was coordinating with the USMS regarding a potential search operation in August 2019.
The email indicates inter-agency communication (FBI, USMS) regarding Epstein's status and activities on his private island.
